title: So why is elo decay even a thing anymore?
body:
Currently, you aren't even required to climb and maintain a climb to obtain season rewards. Basically, just hit gold V (which really ISNT that hard, anyone who is able to play at the average elo silver 4-3 can get G5 just by grinding), sit on your ass and collect season rewards. Meanwhile, plat + players must play a ranked game every 28 days or face decay and they get the same bundle of rewards except different borders.

Now don't get me wrong, this isn't me hating on Gold players or their rewards because as a diamond player, if I didn't care about keeping the rank, I'd still decay back to gold and still collect rewards. But at this point, why even bother? Everyone gets the same rewards now, so why are plats+ forced to play? I get why master tier and challenger tier face decay because of the ladders but anything else seems silly. If as a diamond player, I must maintain my elo every 28 days to keep my rewards, why don't gold players have to? And as I stated, this isn't an anti-gold post, the better question is outside of masters/challenger, why does anyone have to face decay?

My only theory is to catch boosted players. For example, every 20-25 days when you have a diamond 5 0 LP player gojng 0/15, it's a pretty good indicator that this player was boosted. But that's such an inefficient method of preventing boosting since:

A) most boosters will play a game for them every 20-25 days to prevent decay and suspicion.

B) Most boosts take place at the end of the season to avoid this all together. 

So at this point, you only have this to catch, what? Maybe 0.5% of a player base that is boosted and stick it to the rest of the legit players for a system that isn't efficient anyway? And lyte has already mentioned working on a system to actively catch boosted players/boosts, so clearly he realizes this method isn't efficient either. 

Also, the other incredibly stupid part about this is that your LP decays but *your MMR does not decay.* For example, I have a friend who has to go away for 2 months for on-the job training where he's not able to take any computers/laptops outside of company sponsored ones for online testing that don't allow him to add anything onto it. What if he was diamond? By the time he'd get back, he'd decay down to low plat but when he continues his ranked play, he'd be low plat PLAYING AGAINST DIAMOND PLAYERS. Sure, he'd gain more LP and likely skip divisions but why is he even faced with such a daunting prospect in the first place? To prevent people from purposely decaying to bronze, again, an extremely tiny population that pales in comparison to the legit players this negatively impacts. 

Outside of catching boosters and the LP decay/non MMR decay catching a small amount of abusers, I can't possibly see why you'd have elo decay. Because if your reasoning is that you must maintain your climb/rank to receive rewards, then you're admitting that getting gold isn't hard OR your entire reason is contradicted then by saying you don't want people to lose them once they obtain them, thus the reason for not decaying in gold. Once again, this is not an anti-gold rewards post, but any reasoning you present for gold not decaying makes absolutely no sense and is contradicted completely. And my solution to that isn't to stick it to gold players, it's to remove decay entirely outside of masters/challenge and perfect your elo boosting detection system.

replies.body: Elo decay should remain to a point, it's meant to prevent people from getting rusty and bringing that play upon their teams. It should be 3 months IMO though.

> [{quoted}](name=Aametherar,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ankPIGo6,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2015-07-27T22:45:19.564+0000)
>
> Elo decay should remain to a point, it's meant to prevent people from getting rusty and bringing that play upon their teams. It should be 3 months IMO though.

That's fair but that's completely contradicted by the fact that your MMR doesn't decay, just your LP. I'm diamond 5, 31 LP atm. I lose 50 LP each decay, so if I decayed after my 28 day grace, I believe it would have me as being diamond 5 -19 LP. My next decay would be 7 days later, putting me to plat 1 75 LP. Then in plat, every 7 days after that I'd lose 35 LP. So in three months time, as it fits this example, I'd decay all the way to gold 1 75 LP, but I'd still be playing against diamond players because my MMR didn't decay. So the rust factor is completey taken out of this since your level of competition doesn't change, just your league. So I have to suddenly play against equally skilled players as myself but be in a league and division below what I'm playing at. I have no words for the kind of frustration alone something like that provides.
What if your MMR decayed (to a degree, like 10% max) but your LP stayed the same?

> [{quoted}](name=Linna Excel,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ankPIGo6,comment-id=000300010000,timestamp=2015-07-27T23:09:04.960+0000)
>
> What if your MMR decayed (to a degree, like 10% max) but your LP stayed the same?

That just opens up abuse then. In theory, I could decay my MMR from D5 31lp to low Plat MMR and decay to something along the line of plat 1 and have easier opponents. They should just make the MMR decay to the average MMR of the LP/league/tier your LP decays to.

> [{quoted}](name=HateDaddy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ankPIGo6,comment-id=00030001,timestamp=2015-07-27T22:58:12.951+0000)
>
> That's fair but that's completely contradicted by the fact that your MMR doesn't decay, just your LP. I'm diamond 5, 31 LP atm. I lose 50 LP each decay, so if I decayed after my 28 day grace, I believe it would have me as being diamond 5 -19 LP. My next decay would be 7 days later, putting me to plat 1 75 LP. Then in plat, every 7 days after that I'd lose 35 LP. So in three months time, as it fits this example, I'd decay all the way to gold 1 75 LP, but I'd still be playing against diamond players because my MMR didn't decay. So the rust factor is completey taken out of this since your level of competition doesn't change, just your league. So I have to suddenly play against equally skilled players as myself but be in a league and division below what I'm playing at. I have no words for the kind of frustration alone something like that provides.

I didn't realize that. It doesn't even make sense then and is pretty dumb, it should be the opposite and again 3 months.

> [{quoted}](name=Aametherar,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ankPIGo6,comment-id=000300010001,timestamp=2015-07-27T23:30:32.024+0000)
>
> I didn't realize that. It doesn't even make sense then and is pretty dumb, it should be the opposite and again 3 months.

Many things about the system don't make a ton of sense, logically at least. That's why its partly our responsibility as members of the community to change the things we deem need to be changed, or at the very least spur discussion on the topic in question and propose alternatives.
You're rusty, not bad. A diamond player who hasn't played for 3 years will still be better than a bronze one, and he will get to diamond skill faster. Your MMR SHOULDN'T decay.

> [{quoted}](name=Gorgannan,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ankPIGo6,comment-id=000300010002,timestamp=2015-07-28T18:26:24.031+0000)
>
> You're rusty, not bad. A diamond player who hasn't played for 3 years will still be better than a bronze one, and he will get to diamond skill faster. Your MMR SHOULDN'T decay.

Can confirm, brother left game in season 3, focused on school, was always better than me. Comes back to game after 2 seasons off and I've achieved Diamond, wrecks me in first game we play as a 1v1 warm up. Fuckin talented little punk... I'd swear he cheats but he was sitting across from me at the table.

Its okay, they're planning on punishing plat+ players more.
Their current plan (the one sent out in surveys) is to allow mulligans for promos on gold- players. If you reach promos, lose, and then reach them again, you start with a free win.
Plat+ won't get this.

+1 throw it out immediately

~~nothing to do with the fact that my decay starts in 3 days and my internet wont fix~~

> [{quoted}](name=Ghost Bride,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ankPIGo6,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2015-07-27T23:00:45.899+0000)

> [{quoted}](name=Gorgannan,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ankPIGo6,comment-id=00060001,timestamp=2015-07-28T18:28:32.831+0000)
>
> Play a game in Starbucks.

Been there, done that. Don't go when its crowded. Lol, dem ping spikes op. Sometimes you get a crowd of other LoL players as spectators though. I got mad cheers for a quadra kill, so that was pretty cool.

I can see elo decay for challengers and maybe master level players.  Basically the people good enough to start sniffing the LCS I can see being forced to compete.  For challengers I don't want to see someone get to the top 50 and then not play all season while taking that slot.  For masters, I could see wanting them to keep at the top of their game and encourage them to make a push for the top 100.

That said, below that elo decay probably shouldn't be there.

I've heard wait times at the higher ranks are awful but I don't think this is the answer to that because people only have to play one game a month.  As for elo-boosting, why encourage people who suck to buy it once a month?
I think riot is more worried about boosters and such. I want my gold rewards though :c. I hate ranked....

> [{quoted}](name=ThatAtheist,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ankPIGo6,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2015-07-27T22:46:34.045+0000)
>
> I think riot is more worried about boosters and such. I want my gold rewards though :c. I hate ranked....

I want you to keep your rewards, too. I just don't see why I'm forced to play every 28 days just to keep a different border. It comes off as bitter and I assure you I'm not, I don't want people losing any form of rewards they've obtained period. For me, it doesn't take a lot of effort to get diamond. But for someone who might've spent 800 games climbing from gold might tell you differently and it's even more frustrating to those players.
Because the purpose and  goals of Ranked Decay has nothing to do with shiny pixel borders?

> [{quoted}](name=Sona Ping,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ankPIGo6,comment-id=000400000002,timestamp=2015-07-28T00:58:18.565+0000)
>
> Because the purpose and  goals of Ranked Decay has nothing to do with shiny pixel borders?

Then why does gold, silver and bronze not have decay with that logic.

> [{quoted}](name=HateDaddy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ankPIGo6,comment-id=0004000000020000,timestamp=2015-07-28T01:14:48.944+0000)
>
> Then why does gold, silver and bronze not have decay with that logic.

Because if you aren't supposed to be "resting on your laurels", there's no problem, because BS&G have not the laurels to rest on.
Because there's supposed to be a certain distribution of players across the ranks

Why? The most frustrating thing is writing something up only to be downvoted by a dweller who doesn't even offer why they disagree with you or put thought into it. It's why I don't bother with extremely well thought out posts here anymore because if it's something the vast majority don't agree with and can't low elo circle jerk to, they just downvote it and don't say anything. So yes, it's incredibly annoying.

Most people just vote cause they don't want to bother with the hassle of typing something that someone else will cry over.

It's why I say that they need to disable the voting system all together as that is what makes the forums toxic in itself.

> [{quoted}](name=HateDaddy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ankPIGo6,comment-id=000000000001,timestamp=2015-07-27T22:42:52.104+0000)

So yes, it's incredibly annoying.

It is polite, folks, I will mention, to appropriately respond to a thread you agree or disagree with enough to upvote or downvote. Its just common decency to provide your viewpoint in addition to your approval or disapproval. Best of luck on the Rift friends!
28 days to decay? That seems more than reasonable. If you're not a frequent player do you really deserve higher rewards?
It's so the kiddies that get boosted all the way to diamond don't actually get to keep their diamond border when they have to compete with diamond level players while they have silver mechanics.
